actions.message:
1-5 = Fails
6-9 = Successes (unless otherwise stated by GM)
10 = Criticals

10 + 10 = Critical Pair counts for 4 successes
10 + 10* = Messy Critical counts for 4 successes
**Critical pair containing one or more hunger die*
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
Start Willpower = Composure + Resolve. 
You *cannot* buy extra dots of Willpower either during character creation or with experience points, but you can get more through increased Composure and/or Resolve.
When rolling Willpower you unly roll with you *undamaged* levels of Willpower (ie. 2 superficial damage means two less dice)

0 Wilpower = Impaired, receiving a -2 dice penalty to Social and Mental tests. They still get to roll one die if required to roll their pool, as per the usual rules.

**Spending Willpower**
■ Re-roll up to three regular dice, (not Hunger dice) in any dice pool (with some exceptions)
■ Take control of your character for one turn during frenzy or when under the influence of super- natural coercion, such as Dominate or Presence (see p. 255).
■ Minute movements while staked
■ Ignore Health damage penalties
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
**Increase Attribute:**   New level x 5
**Increase Skill:**       New level x 3
**New Specialty:**        3
**Clan Discipline:**      New level x 5
**Other Discipline:**     New level x 7
**Blood Sorcery Ritual:** Ritual level x 3
**Advantage:**            3 per dot
**Blood Potency:**        New level x 10
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
**Lists:**
Characters = A list over character information commands

**Rules:**
Healing = Healing system, both for Health (Physical Battle) and Willpower (Social Battle)
Rolls = Dice rolls rules explained
Willpower = short list over willpower rules/spending functions
XP = experience cost list (evt. see p137 in the book)

**Misc.:**
Drive = Gives the link to the RPG google drive

actions.name: Send Image

actions.message:
**Name:**         "Ironclad"
**Child:**        Steffi
**Clan:**         Brujah
**Description:**
The Ironclad is a bulky fellow who is never seen without his black leather jacket with too many badges to count, or his polarized dark Ray-Ban-style sunglasses. Yes, even in his sunless existence, her wears his damn sunglasses. His hair is dark and his short beard likewise, and he tends to like wearing a red bandanna on the top of his head.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message: Approximate visualization of the "Ironclad" (minus his heavy leather jacket though)
actions.name: Send Image

actions.message:
**Name:**         Detective Shane Well
**Status:**       Alive
**Race:**         Mortal
**Occupation:**   Police Officer (Detective)
**Workplace:**    Metropolitan Police
**Description:**
Detective Well is a serious-looking fella, who seems confident and stern and has a good deal of experience within the Police force. As a contact of the Sheriff, he has been made available to the coterie, though only as a “loan”. When he met the coterie at Hotel Savoy, he seemed nervous and wary of them, and clearly not used to be treated as “nicely” as they did. He left, however, with a realization that he might prefer being treated un-nicely, but predictable, over the coterie he doesn’t quite know where he has. His mind was wiped of the worst of it though, but he still bears an uneasy feeling with these new “investigators” that Dalton has “lent” him out to.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/133tXXvBOV9Nq-Pb2UNMxm_E9pmtC_gpK?usp=sharing
actions.name: Send Message

actions.message:
**Name:**         Carmen Pinilla Padilla
**Status:**       Alive
**Race:**         Mortal
**Occupation:**   Principal
**Workplace:**    Vicente Cañada Blanch Spanish School
**Description:**
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
**Name:**         Casper Drum
**Status:**       Dead
**Race:**         Mortal
**Occupation:**   Student (College Jock)
**Workplace:**    Out of City College
**Description:**
Victim number one, Casper Drum, was found four days ago, tucked away in a storm drain. Unfortunately, recent rains have made a mess of the crime scene. Casper was a strapping young lad in his early twenties, attending college in another city but home over a hiatus in his studies. He gives the impression of being a young instragram heavy using Jock and often poses with the football sweater of his team.
*Zeferet* found his number (for whatever he wants to use it for), and his parents address here in London, where he was staying. Currently his body is in the local Morgue, not yet investigated.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
**Name:**         Don Ellard
**Status:**       Dead
**Race:**         Mortal
**Occupation:**   Basement Cooker?
**Workplace:**    Basement?
**Description:**
Victim number two, Don Ellard, was found two days ago in a copse of trees in James' Park, splayed on a rock and emptied of blood, which is why Well immediately contacted Dalton. The site has since been cleared but little else of note was found. 
Don was a man in his mid-thirties, who still lived in his parents’ basement and had no registered place of work. Despite the popular images of such individuals he was quite a looker. 
The Detective revealed for the coterie that it seemed he was living larger than he should be able to afford, even if supported financially by his parents. Additionally, he reconised some of his buys and he might have had something to do with cooking ecstasy.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
**Name:**         Shelly DiSanto
**Status:**       Dead
**Race:**         Mortal
**Occupation:**   Vagrant
**Workplace:**    None
**Description:**
Well directed them to a long-abandoned apartment building , and asked that the coterie contact him with instructions when they are done at the scene. 
On the third floor there is an obvious squat, where someone has been living for quite some time. There is rudimentary scavenged furniture, bedding, and drug equipment. In one of the rooms lies the corpse of a vagrant , similarly savaged as the earlier victims, but visibly less so.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
**Name:**         Bradon Cortez
**Status:**       Dead
**Race:**         Mortal
**Occupation:**   Model and Sex Worker
**Workplace:**    ?
**Description:**
A fourth victim has been found, and this time, there’s no keeping the lid on. When the vampires were sleeping, a janitor stumbled upon the corpse of Braden Cortez, male model and sex worker, in a suite at a nearby hotel. This time, the coterie is told that the murder scene is more elaborate and the police are all over it. Unfortunately, Well himself hasn’t got access.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
**Name:**         Frank Matthews
**Child:**        Elizabeth
**Clan:**         Ventrue
**Description:**
Mr. Matthews is a little bit of an older gentleman, if you had to guess, he must have been around the late 40’s when he was turned. You aren’t sure how old he is, but he often refers to the days of the 19th century, so he must be around 200 years at least. He often wears some kind of suit in light greyish colours to match his silvering hair. Though, on occasion, he has been caught in “just” wearing a vest or a shirt and pullover combination. He acts as an English gentleman most of the time, tho he seems to have a weakness for a pretty face, and can be a little... "flirting" and thats putting it nicely.
actions.name: Set Embed Description

actions.message:
**Superficial Healing**
**Health:** Depending on their Blood Potency (see bottom of sheet under "Mending"), a vampire can mend one or more points of Superficial Health damage with a single Rouse Check. Vampires can make one Rouse Check per turn to mend Superficial Health damage.

**Willpower:** Each "story" players heal Superficial Willpower damages equal to their *Composure* OR *Resolve* scores (use highest). 


**Aggravated Healing**
**Health:** takes an entire night, and upon the next sundown the Kindred makes three *Rouse checks* in addition to the one for awakening (4 checks in all), and heals **one** Aggravated health level, as well as one Crippling Injury or similar impairment. A vampire can only mend one point of Aggravated damage per night. As with awakening, if these Rouse Checks raise the vampire’s Hunger above Hunger 5, they fall into torpor rather than testing for hunger frenzy. You succeed in healing no matter the dice result, though you can risk a rapid increase of *Hunger*.

**Willpower:** At the start of the next story, a character who has acted in accordance to their Ambition can heal 1 level of Aggravated Willpower damage.

*Story being a natural "chapter" in the campaign determined by the Storyteller. Fx. by the end of an objective.
